There are no disease entities mentioned in the paragraph. The paragraph discusses the use of mice in a genetic study to investigate the relationship between nicotine-induced seizures and the concentration of alpha-bungarotoxin nicotinic receptor.

None of these entities can be considered diseases. Mice are animals used in scientific research, nicotine is a substance found in tobacco, seizures are a symptom of various neurological disorders, and alpha-bungarotoxin nicotinic receptor is a protein found in the nervous system.
